- **VAT Rate:** 19.25% total (standard rate + council surtax); exports zero-rated
- **VAT Registration Threshold:** XAF 50 million turnover
- **Withholding Tax on Services (Resident Companies):** 5.5% (5% + 10% council surtax)
- **CEMAC Exception:** NO withholding tax on service fee payments to residents of CEMAC region
- **Distribution Tax on Dividends:** 10% for companies with turnover ≤ XAF 3 billion (reduced from 15%)
- **Money Transfer Tax:** XAF 4 per transaction on transfers by credit/microfinance institutions
- **Source:** [Cameroon Corporate Tax PWC](https://taxsummaries.pwc.com/republic-of-cameroon/corporate/taxes-on-corporate-income), [Cameroon Tax Rates](https://www.lloydsbanktrade.com/en/market-potential/cameroon/taxes)

#### Central Bank Circulars & Regulations (COBAC)
- **Regulatory Authority:** Banking Commission of Central Africa (COBAC) for CEMAC zone
- **Key Regulation:** COBAC Regulation No. 01/17/CEMAC/UMAC/COBAC (September 27, 2017) governing microfinance in CEMAC
- **Approval Procedure:** COBAC MFI Regulation R-2017/05 (conditions for approval of MFIs, executives, statutory auditors)

- **MFI Categories:** Three categories with different capital requirements per COBAC Regulation MFI R-2017/03
  - **Note:** Exact capital amounts for each category not publicly detailed in search results; requires direct consultation of R-2017/03
  - **Current Licensed MFIs (December 31, 2024):** 390 licensed MFIs operating in Cameroon across categories 1, 2, and 3
  - **Source:** [Complete Guide MFI Licensing Cameroon 2025](https://dgtcfm.cm/en/microfinance-institution-licensing-cameroon/)

- **Payment Services Capital Requirements:**
  - **Minimum Share Capital:** XAF 500 million (approximately $827,852 USD) to operate as payment service provider
  - **Source:** [Payment Services Regulation Update Cameroon](https://www.lexology.com/library/detail.aspx?g=d9c478ed-6761-4988-812a-c78c4813a22d)

- **Licensing Process:**
  - **Application Submission:** To Ministry of Finance (monetary authority) against acknowledgment of receipt
  - **COBAC Review:** Copy transmitted to COBAC for opinion
  - **Approval Flow:** Institutional shuttle (MINFI → COBAC → COBAC → MINFI) within regulatory deadlines
  - **Final Approval:** Issued by Minister of Finance after favorable COBAC opinion
  - **Source:** [Navigating Banking Regulations Cameroon](https://www.hallelaw.com/navigating-banking-regulations-for-startups-in-cameroon-your-complete-guide/)

- **Microfinance-Specific Tax Benefits:**
  - **Collateral/Mortgage Loans (Category 1 MFIs):** Exempted from registration formality and graduated stamp duty
  - **Bad Debt Deductibility:** Threshold increased from XAF 500,000 to XAF 3 million for credit institutions
  - **Provision Deduction:** Prior certification by statutory auditor required when amount ≥ XAF 50 million per year
  - **Source:** [Cameroon Corporate Tax Other Taxes](https://taxsummaries.pwc.com/republic-of-cameroon/corporate/other-taxes)

#### Licensing Requirements
- **Application:** Submit to Ministry of Finance with transmission to COBAC
- **Capital:** Per COBAC MFI R-2017/03 (category-specific)
- **Approval:** Minister of Finance after favorable COBAC opinion
- **Timeline:** Per regulatory deadlines (specific duration not detailed in sources)
- **Source:** COBAC regulations 2017

## TIER 3: TANZANIA, UGANDA, RWANDA (EAST AFRICA)

### TANZANIA

#### Tax Regime
- **Corporate Tax Rate:** 30% for resident corporations and PEs
- **Reduced Rates:**
  - **DSE-Listed Companies (30%+ public shares):** 25% for 3 consecutive years
  - **Pharmaceuticals/Leather Manufacturers (with government performance agreement):** 20% for first 5 years
  - **Vehicle/Boat Assembly, Outboard Engines:** 10% for first 5 years
- **Alternative Minimum Tax (AMT):** 1% of turnover for companies with perpetual unrelieved tax losses for current + preceding 2 years
  - **Exemptions:** Agricultural companies, tea processing (3 years from July 2024-June 2027), health/education providers
- **VAT Rate:** 18% (Mainland Tanzania); 16% reduced rate on specified B2C purchases via bank/electronic payment; 15% (Zanzibar) with 18% for banking, postal, telecom, insurance, digital services
- **VAT Registration Threshold:** TZS 200 million annual turnover
- **VAT on Financial Services:** EXEMPT (banking, lending, insurance are exempt supplies)
- **Withholding Tax Rates:** Vary by payment type and residency
- **Source:** [Tanzania Corporate Tax PWC](https://taxsummaries.pwc.com/tanzania/corporate/taxes-on-corporate-income), [VAT Tanzania Guide 2024](https://www.tanzaniainvest.com/vat), [Finance Act 2024 Tanzania](https://www.ey.com/en_gl/technical/tax-alerts/tanzanian-finance-act-2024-makes-changes-affecting-businesses-and-individuals)

- **Double Taxation Treaties (DTAs):** In force with Canada, Denmark, Finland, India, Italy, Norway, South Africa, Sweden, Zambia
  - **Recent Signings:** Oman (2024), Czech Republic (2025) - not yet ratified
  - **Notable Absence:** No treaties yet with UK, USA, China
  - **India-Tanzania Treaty:** WHT on FTS exempt if no PE in Tanzania (vs. 15% normally)
  - **Zambia Treaty:** 0% on dividends, interest, royalties
  - **Source:** [Tanzania Double Taxation Agreements](https://www.tra.go.tz/index.php/double-taxation-agreements), [Tanzania Tax Law Guide 2024](https://www.taxriskmanagement.com/tanzania-tax-law/)

#### Central Bank Circulars & Regulations
- **Regulatory Authority:** Bank of Tanzania (BoT)
- **Tier Structure:**
  - **Tier 1:** Deposit-taking institutions (banks, microfinance banks)
  - **Tier 2:** Non-deposit-taking microfinance service providers
  - **Tier 3:** SACCOs
  - **Tier 4:** Community microfinance groups
  - **Source:** [Tanzania Microfinance Act 2018](https://media.tanzlii.org/media/legislation/47290/source_file/6f5016f4125238fe/2018-10.pdf)

- **Minimum Capital Requirements (2025 Regulations - Current):**
  - **Tier 2 Non-Deposit Taking MSPs (Majority Foreign Ownership):** TZS 500 million
  - **Tier 2 Non-Deposit Taking MSPs (Majority Local Ownership):** TZS 20 million
  - **Grace Period:** Foreign-owned MSPs in operation before 2025 Regulations have 12 months to comply
  - **Tier 3 SACCOs Category A:** TZS 10 million minimum core capital
  - **Tier 3 SACCOs Category B:** TZS 200 million minimum core capital
  - **Source:** [Tanzania Microfinance Regulations 2025](https://www.clydeco.com/en/insights/2025/04/an-overview-of-the-microfinance-regulations-2025)

- **Key Changes in 2025 Regulations:**
  - **Broadened Integrity Assessment (Reg. 7):** Now extends to partners, trustees, shareholders; BoT considers credit reference bureau reports
  - **CEO/Governing Body Approval (Reg. 48):** Prior BoT approval required before appointing CEO or governing body members; must submit completed questionnaire (4th schedule)
  - **Application Compliance Window:** 60 days to meet all requirements; application cancelled if not met
  - **Source:** [Draft Microfinance Regulations 2024 Tanzania](https://velmalaw.co.tz/news/draft-microfinance-non-deposit-taking-microfinance-service-providers-regulations-2024/)

#### Licensing Requirements
- **Application:** Submit to Bank of Tanzania with business plan, capital evidence, integrity documentation
- **Timeline:** 60-day compliance window for application requirements
- **Capital:** TZS 20 million (local majority) or TZS 500 million (foreign majority) for Tier 2
- **Prior Approvals:** CEO and governing body appointments require BoT approval before appointment
- **Source:** Tanzania Microfinance Regulations 2025

---

### UGANDA

#### Tax Regime
- **Corporate Tax Rate:** 30% for resident companies and foreign company branches
- **Branch Extra Tax:** 15% on repatriated income for foreign company branches (in addition to 30% CIT)
- **Mining Companies:** 25% or 45% depending on chargeable income
- **VAT Rate:** 18% standard rate
- **VAT Exemptions:** Financial services, health/life insurance, agriculture insurance, re-insurance, certain residential properties, betting/gaming, education, medical services, imported drugs/medicines, pesticides, animal feeds
- **Withholding Tax (Non-Residents):** 15% on dividends, rent, natural resource payments, interest, royalties, management fees from Uganda sources
- **Withholding Tax (Residents):**
  - **Dividends (DSE-listed companies to individuals):** 10%
  - **Government Securities Interest:** 20% (<10 years maturity), 10% (≥10 years maturity)
  - **Telecom/Mobile Money Commissions:** 10% (final tax on resident individuals)
  - **Insurance/Advertising Agent Commissions:** 10%
  - **Payment Service Provider Commissions (2024 Amendment):** 10%
- **Source:** [Uganda Corporate Tax PWC](https://taxsummaries.pwc.com/uganda/corporate/taxes-on-corporate-income), [Uganda Tax Amendments 2024](https://www.ey.com/en_gl/technical/tax-alerts/uganda-issues-tax-amendment-acts-for-2024)

- **2024 Tax Amendments (Effective July 1, 2024):**
  - **Loss Carryforward Restriction:** Full carryforward limited to 7 years; 50% cap on available losses after 7 years
  - **Digital Services Income Tax:** 5% on non-resident persons deriving income from digital services in Uganda
  - **Source:** [Uganda Tax Laws Effective July 2024](https://www.mmaks.co.ug/sites/default/files/article-attachments/Legal%20Alert%20on%20Tax%20Amendments%202024%20-%20June%202024.pdf)

#### Central Bank Circulars & Regulations
- **Regulatory Authority:** Bank of Uganda (BoU) for Tiers I, II, III; Uganda Microfinance Regulatory Authority (UMRA) for Tier IV
- **Tier Structure:**
  - **Tier I:** Commercial Banks (including Islamic Banking)
  - **Tier II:** Credit Institutions
  - **Tier III:** Microfinance Deposit-Taking Institutions (MDIs)
  - **Tier IV:** Non-Deposit Taking MFIs, SACCOs, Self-Help Groups, Community-Based MFIs, Money Lenders
  - **Source:** [Legal Guide Uganda Financial Sector](https://taslafadvocates.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/Legal-Guide-to-Ugandas-Financial-Sector3-1.pdf)

- **Minimum Capital Requirements (2024):**
  - **Tier I Commercial Banks:** UGX 150 billion (approximately $40.7 million) by December 2024 - INCREASED from prior requirement
  - **Tier II Credit Institutions:** UGX 25 billion (approximately $6.8 million) - INCREASED from UGX 1 billion
  - **Tier III MDIs:** UGX 10 billion (approximately $2.7 million) - INCREASED from UGX 500 million (introduced 2003)
  - **Tier IV (UMRA-regulated):** SACCOs must maintain minimum equity (10% of total assets minimum core capital)
  - **Source:** [Uganda Minimum Capital Rules](https://www.theeastafrican.co.ke/tea/business/uganda-s-new-rules-for-lenders-kick-in-rattle-investors-4320052), [Banking Regulation Uganda 2025](https://practiceguides.chambers.com/practice-guides/banking-regulation-2025/uganda/trends-and-developments)

- **Recent Regulatory Developments (2024):**
  - **Financial Institutions (Corporate Governance) Regulations 2024:** Replaced 2005 regulations
  - **Microfinance Deposit-Taking Institutions (Corporate Governance) Regulations 2024:** Extended governance oversight to MDIs
  - **Micro Finance Deposit-Taking Institutions (Revision of Minimum Capital Requirements) Instrument 2024:** Implemented new UGX 10 billion requirement
  - **Industry Consolidation:** Two tier II institutions closed by BoU for failing to meet minimum capital; some commercial banks downgraded licenses to meet requirements
  - **Source:** [Banking Regulation Uganda 2024](https://practiceguides.chambers.com/practice-guides/banking-regulation-2024/uganda)

- **Tier IV Licensing (UMRA):**
  - **Requirement:** All Tier 4 MFIs and Money Lenders must have valid UMRA license
  - **Validity:** One calendar year (expires December 31 of issue year)
  - **Source:** [UMRA Regulation](https://umra.go.ug/service/regulation/)

#### Licensing Requirements
- **Application:** Submit to Bank of Uganda (Tiers I-III) or UMRA (Tier IV)
- **Capital:** Per tier requirements above
